Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a habitat, showing both land and water environments.
The student can include different types of living things found in each habitat, such as trees, grasses, and animals like squirrels and fish.
The student can show how plants and animals are arranged or organized in the habitat.
The student can demonstrate understanding of the diversity of living things by illustrating a variety of plants and animals.
The student can label or otherwise identify patterns in the natural world within their drawing, such as the similarities and differences between different habitats.
